qas.question: What is the Münzkabinett der TUI-AG?
What is the name of the largest police museum in Germany?
Where can you find carpets and objects from the orient?
Other than in Hanover, where else can you find a Blind Man Museum?
What is the main topic of the Kunsthalle Faust?
What is a box of coins?
What is the name of the only police Museum in Germany?
What building contains textiles from all over Germany?
Carpets and other objects from around the world can be found in what museum?

plausible_answers.text: the 150 years old history of the application of energy

qas.question: What does the Museum of natural energy history describe

context: <a0_0>A cabinet of coins<a0_0/> is the <b5_0>Münzkabinett der TUI-AG<b5_0/>. <b6_0>The <a1_0>Polizeigeschichtliche Sammlung Niedersachsen<b6_0/><a1_0/> is the largest police museum in Germany. Textiles from all over the world can be visited in the <b7_0>Museum for textile art<b7_0/>. The EXPOseeum is the museum of the world-exhibition "EXPO 2000 Hannover". Carpets and objects from the orient can be visited in the <a2_0><b8_0>Oriental Carpet Museum<b8_0/><a2_0/>. The Blind Man Museum is a rarity in Germany, another one is only in <a3_0>Berlin<a3_0/>. The Museum of veterinary medicine is unique in Germany. The Museum for Energy History describes <b9_0>the 150 years old history of the application of energy<b9_0/>. The Home Museum Ahlem shows the history of the district of Ahlem. The Mahn- und Gedenkstätte Ahlem describes the history of the Jewish people in Hanover and the Stiftung Ahlers Pro Arte / Kestner Pro Arte shows modern art. <a4_0>Modern art<a4_0/> is also the main topic of the Kunsthalle Faust, the Nord/LB Art Gellery and of the Foro Artistico / Eisfabrik.
